verses.text: After Joshua died, the descendants of Israel asked of the Lord, saying, “Who shall be first to go up for us to fight against the Canaanites?” And the Lord said, “Judah shall go up.
parts: After Joshua died, the descendants of Israel asked of the Lord, saying, “Who shall be first to go up for us to fight against the Canaanites?”
And the Lord said, “Judah shall go up.

verses.text: So Judah said to Simeon his brother, “Come up with me to my allotted territory, so that we can stand in battle formation against the Canaanites; and I will go with you to your allotted territory.” And Simeon went with him.
parts: So Judah said to Simeon his brother, “Come up with me to my allotted territory, so that we can stand in battle formation against the Canaanites; and I will go with you to your allotted territory.” And Simeon went with him.

verses.text: Then Judah went up, and the Lord delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand; and they killed ten thousand men at Bezek.
parts: Then Judah went up, and the Lord delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand; and they killed ten thousand men at Bezek.

verses.text: And they overtook Adoni-Bezek in Bezek, and stood in formation against him; and they slaughtered the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
parts: And they overtook Adoni-Bezek in Bezek, and stood in formation against him; and they slaughtered the Canaanites and the Perizzites.

verses.text: Then Adoni-Bezek fled, and they pursued him and caught him and cut off his thumbs and big toes.
parts: Then Adoni-Bezek fled, and they pursued him and caught him and cut off his thumbs and big toes.

verses.text: And Adoni-Bezek said, “Seventy kings with their thumbs and big toes cut off used to gather the things under my table; God has repaid me for what I have done.” They then brought him to Jerusalem, where he died.
parts: And Adoni-Bezek said, “Seventy kings with their thumbs and big toes cut off used to gather the things under my table; God has repaid me for what I have done.” They then brought him to Jerusalem, where he died.

verses.text: Now the sons of Judah fought against Jerusalem, and captured it by striking it with the edge of the sword and setting the city on fire.
parts: Now the sons of Judah fought against Jerusalem, and captured it by striking it with the edge of the sword and setting the city on fire.

verses.text: Afterward the sons of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites who dwelt in the mountains, in the plains of the South.
parts: Afterward the sons of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites who dwelt in the mountains, in the plains of the South.

verses.text: Then Judah went against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron, and Hebron—previously called Kirjath Arba—went out against them.
parts: Then Judah went against the Canaanites who dwelt in Hebron, and Hebron—previously called Kirjath Arba—went out against them.

verses.text: From there they went up against the inhabitants of Debir—previously called Kirjath Sepher, the City of Letters. Then Caleb said, “Whoever attacks the City of Letters and takes it, to him I will give my daughter Achsah as wife.” And Othniel the younger son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.
parts: From there they went up against the inhabitants of Debir—previously called Kirjath Sepher, the City of Letters.

Then Caleb said, “Whoever attacks the City of Letters and takes it, to him I will give my daughter Achsah as wife.” And Othniel the younger son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.

verses.text: Then Caleb said, “Whoever attacks the City of Letters and takes it, to him I will give my daughter Achsah as wife.”
parts: Then Caleb said, “Whoever attacks the City of Letters and takes it, to him I will give my daughter Achsah as wife.”

verses.text: And Othniel the younger son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.
parts: And Othniel the younger son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it; so Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.

verses.text: And it came to be at the reception, Othniel urged her to ask her father for a field; and she complained and cried out from her donkey, “You have delivered me into a southern land.” And Caleb responded to her, “What is your request?”
parts: And it came to be at the reception, Othniel urged her to ask her father for a field; and she complained and cried out from her donkey, “You have delivered me into a southern land.” And Caleb responded to her, “What is your request?”

verses.text: So Achsah said to him, “Give me a blessing; since you have delivered me into a southern land, give me the water as well.” And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs, as was the desire of her heart.
parts: So Achsah said to him, “Give me a blessing; since you have delivered me into a southern land, give me the water as well.” And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the lower springs, as was the desire of her heart.

verses.text: Now the sons of the Kenite, Moses’ father-in-law, went up from the City of Palms with the sons of Judah into the desert of Judah, in the south of Judah, at the descent of Arad; and they went and dwelt with the people.
parts: Now the sons of the Kenite, Moses’ father-in-law, went up from the City of Palms with the sons of Judah into the desert of Judah, in the south of Judah, at the descent of Arad; and they went and dwelt with the people.

verses.text: And Judah went with his brother Simeon, and they attacked the Canaanites who inhabited Zephath and utterly destroyed them.
parts: And Judah went with his brother Simeon, and they attacked the Canaanites who inhabited Zephath and utterly destroyed them.

verses.text: And Judah did not inherit Gaza nor her coasts, nor Ashkelon with its territory, nor Accaron nor her coasts, nor Ekron with its territory.
parts: And Judah did not inherit Gaza nor her coasts, nor Ashkelon with its territory, nor Accaron nor her coasts, nor Ekron with its territory.

verses.text: The Lord was with Judah, and he inherited the mountain; for they could not completely destroy the inhabitants of the lowland, because Rechab prevented it.
parts: The Lord was with Judah, and he inherited the mountain; for they could not completely destroy the inhabitants of the lowland, because Rechab prevented it.

verses.text: And they gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had said, and after this he inherited the three cities of the sons of Anak.
parts: And they gave Hebron to Caleb, as Moses had said, and after this he inherited the three cities of the sons of Anak.

verses.text: But the sons of Benjamin did not secure the Jebusites who dwelt in Jerusalem; so the Jebusites dwell with the sons of Benjamin in Jerusalem until this day.
parts: But the sons of Benjamin did not secure the Jebusites who dwelt in Jerusalem; so the Jebusites dwell with the sons of Benjamin in Jerusalem until this day.

verses.text: And the sons of Joseph also went up to Bethel, and the Lord was with them. Then they set up camp and spied on Bethel—previously named Luz.
parts: And the sons of Joseph also went up to Bethel, and the Lord was with them.
Then they set up camp and spied on Bethel—previously named Luz.

verses.text: Then they set up camp and spied on Bethel—previously named Luz.
parts: Then they set up camp and spied on Bethel—previously named Luz.

verses.text: And when the spies looked, they noticed a man leaving the city and they seized him and said to him, “Show us the entrance to the city and we will be merciful to you.”
parts: And when the spies looked, they noticed a man leaving the city and they seized him and said to him, “Show us the entrance to the city and we will be merciful to you.”

verses.text: And he showed them the entrance to the city, and they struck the city with the edge of the sword, but they let the man and his family leave.
parts: And he showed them the entrance to the city, and they struck the city with the edge of the sword, but they let the man and his family leave.

verses.text: And the man escaped to the land of the Hittites, where he built a city he called Luz.
parts: And the man escaped to the land of the Hittites, where he built a city he called Luz.

verses.text: However, Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shean, a city of Scythians, nor her towns and suburbs, nor Taanach and her suburbs, nor the inhabitants of Dor and its suburbs, nor the inhabitants of Balak and its daughters, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and its suburbs and its daughters, nor the inhabitants of Jeblaham and its suburbs and its daughters; indeed, the Canaanites began to dwell in this land. And when Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites under forced labor, but they did not drive them out completely.
parts: However, Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shean, a city of Scythians, nor her towns and suburbs, nor Taanach and her suburbs, nor the inhabitants of Dor and its suburbs, nor the inhabitants of Balak and its daughters, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and its suburbs and its daughters, nor the inhabitants of Jeblaham and its suburbs and its daughters; indeed, the Canaanites began to dwell in this land.
And when Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites under forced labor, but they did not drive them out completely.

verses.text: And when Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites under forced labor, but they did not drive them out completely.
parts: And when Israel became strong, they put the Canaanites under forced labor, but they did not drive them out completely.

verses.text: Ephraim did not drive out the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer; so the Canaanites dwelt in the midst of them in Gezer and paid taxes.
parts: Ephraim did not drive out the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer; so the Canaanites dwelt in the midst of them in Gezer and paid taxes.

verses.text: Nor did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Domana; so the Canaanites dwelt in the midst of them and paid taxes.
parts: Nor did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Domana; so the Canaanites dwelt in the midst of them and paid taxes.

verses.text: Nor did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Acco, though they did pay taxes to them, nor the inhabitants of Dor, nor the inhabitants of Sidon, nor the inhabitants of Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Nai, or Ereo.
parts: Nor did Asher drive out the inhabitants of Acco, though they did pay taxes to them, nor the inhabitants of Dor, nor the inhabitants of Sidon, nor the inhabitants of Ahlab, Achzib, Helbah, Nai, or Ereo.

verses.text: So Asher dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for he was not able to drive them out.
parts: So Asher dwelt in the midst of the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for he was not able to drive them out.

verses.text: Nor did Naphtali drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh, nor the inhabitants of Beth Anath; but Naphtali dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land.
parts: Nor did Naphtali drive out the inhabitants of Beth Shemesh, nor the inhabitants of Beth Anath; but Naphtali dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land.

verses.text: And the Amorites forced the sons of Dan into the mountains, for they would not allow them to come down to the valley.
parts: And the Amorites forced the sons of Dan into the mountains, for they would not allow them to come down to the valley.

verses.text: And the Amorites began to dwell in the mountain of the myrtle-grove, where there were bears and foxes; yet the hand of the house of Joseph was heavy upon the Amorite, and he came to pay tribute to them.
parts: And the Amorites began to dwell in the mountain of the myrtle-grove, where there were bears and foxes; yet the hand of the house of Joseph was heavy upon the Amorite, and he came to pay tribute to them.

verses.text: Now the boundary of the Amorites went upward from the Ascent of Akrabbim, from the Rock.
parts: Now the boundary of the Amorites went upward from the Ascent of Akrabbim, from the Rock.

headers: The Efforts of Judah and Benjamin

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord came up from Gilgal to the place of weeping, and to Bethel and to the house of Israel, and said to them, “Thus says the Lord: I led you up from Egypt and brought you to the land I promised your fathers; and I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you. And you shall make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; nor shall you worship their gods, but you will destroy their graven images and you shall tear down their altars.’ But you did not obey My voice, for you did these things.
parts: Then the Angel of the Lord came up from Gilgal to the place of weeping, and to Bethel and to the house of Israel, and said to them, “Thus says the Lord: I led you up from Egypt and brought you to the land I promised your fathers; and I said, ‘I will never break My covenant with you.

And you shall make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; nor shall you worship their gods, but you will destroy their graven images and you shall tear down their altars.’ But you did not obey My voice, for you did these things.

verses.text: Therefore I also said, ‘I will not drive them out before you, and they shall become as snares, and their gods shall be a cause for stumbling for you.’ ”
parts: Therefore I also said, ‘I will not drive them out before you, and they shall become as snares, and their gods shall be a cause for stumbling for you.’ ”

verses.text: When the Angel of the Lord spoke these words to all the sons of Israel, the people lifted up their voices and wept.
parts: When the Angel of the Lord spoke these words to all the sons of Israel, the people lifted up their voices and wept.

verses.text: And they called that place the Place of Weeping; and there they made a sacrifice to the Lord.
parts: And they called that place the Place of Weeping; and there they made a sacrifice to the Lord.

verses.text: And when Joshua had dismissed the people, each man went to his inheritance to take possession of his land.
parts: And when Joshua had dismissed the people, each man went to his inheritance to take possession of his land.

verses.text: So the people served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who saw every great deed the Lord did for Israel.
parts: So the people served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders who outlived Joshua, who saw every great deed the Lord did for Israel.

verses.text: Now Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at one hundred and ten years old.
parts: Now Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at one hundred and ten years old.

verses.text: And they buried him within the border of his inheritance at Timnath Heres, on Mount Ephraim, on the north side of Mount Gaash.
parts: And they buried him within the border of his inheritance at Timnath Heres, on Mount Ephraim, on the north side of Mount Gaash.

verses.text: And when all that generation were laid with their fathers, another generation arose after them who did not know the Lord, nor the work He had done for Israel.
parts: And when all that generation were laid with their fathers, another generation arose after them who did not know the Lord, nor the work He had done for Israel.

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel did evil before the Lord and served the Baals.
parts: Then the sons of Israel did evil before the Lord and served the Baals.

verses.text: They forsook the Lord God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt; they followed other gods from among the gods of the nations all around them, and they bowed down to them.
parts: They forsook the Lord God of their fathers, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt; they followed other gods from among the gods of the nations all around them, and they bowed down to them.

verses.text: They forsook Him and served Baal and the Ashtoreths.
parts: They forsook Him and served Baal and the Ashtoreths.

verses.text: And the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel.
parts: And the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel.

verses.text: Whenever they went out, the hand of the Lord was against them for calamity, as the Lord had spoken, and as the Lord had sworn to them.
parts: Whenever they went out, the hand of the Lord was against them for calamity, as the Lord had spoken, and as the Lord had sworn to them.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the Lord raised up judges and the Lord saved them from the hand of those who plundered them.
parts: Nevertheless, the Lord raised up judges and the Lord saved them from the hand of those who plundered them.

verses.text: But even so, they would not listen to their judges, but instead they played the harlot with other gods and bowed down to them.
parts: But even so, they would not listen to their judges, but instead they played the harlot with other gods and bowed down to them.

verses.text: And the Lord raised up judges for them, the Lord was with the judge and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge; for the Lord was moved by their groaning because of those who besieged them and harassed them.
parts: And the Lord raised up judges for them, the Lord was with the judge and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge; for the Lord was moved by their groaning because of those who besieged them and harassed them.

verses.text: And when the judge was dead, they went back to their former ways and behaved more corruptly than their fathers, by following other gods, serving them, and bowing down to them.
parts: And when the judge was dead, they went back to their former ways and behaved more corruptly than their fathers, by following other gods, serving them, and bowing down to them.

verses.text: Then the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel; and He said, “Because this nation set aside My covenant which I commanded their fathers, and has not heeded My voice, therefore I will not drive away from your presence any more of the men Joshua the son of Nun left in the land.” And the Lord left them, to test Israel by them, to see whether they would keep the ways of the Lord, to walk in them and keep them as their fathers did.
parts: Then the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel; and He said, “Because this nation set aside My covenant which I commanded their fathers, and has not heeded My voice, therefore I will not drive away from your presence any more of the men Joshua the son of Nun left in the land.” And the Lord left them, to test Israel by them, to see whether they would keep the ways of the Lord, to walk in them and keep them as their fathers did.

verses.text: therefore I will not drive away from your presence any more of the men Joshua the son of Nun left in the land.” And the Lord left them,
parts: therefore I will not drive away from your presence any more of the men Joshua the son of Nun left in the land.” And the Lord left them,

verses.text: to test Israel by them, to see whether they would keep the ways of the Lord, to walk in them and keep them as their fathers did.
parts: to test Israel by them, to see whether they would keep the ways of the Lord, to walk in them and keep them as their fathers did.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord left those nations without driving them out immediately; and He did not deliver them into the hand of Joshua.
parts: Therefore the Lord left those nations without driving them out immediately; and He did not deliver them into the hand of Joshua.

verses.text: Now these are the nations the Lord left so that He might test Israel by them, that is, all who did not experience firsthand any of the wars in Canaan (only for the sake of the generations of Israel, to teach them warfare; only those who did not previously experience it): the five provinces of the foreign nations, and every Canaanite, and the Sidonites, and the Hivites who dwelt in Lebanon, from Mount Hermon to Laboemath.
parts: Now these are the nations the Lord left so that He might test Israel by them, that is, all who did not experience firsthand any of the wars in Canaan

(only for the sake of the generations of Israel, to teach them warfare; only those who did not previously experience it): the five provinces of the foreign nations, and every Canaanite, and the Sidonites, and the Hivites who dwelt in Lebanon, from Mount Hermon to Laboemath.

verses.text: And it was so that He might test Israel by them, to know whether they would hear the commandments of the Lord which He commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.
parts: And it was so that He might test Israel by them, to know whether they would hear the commandments of the Lord which He commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.

verses.text: Thus the sons of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
parts: Thus the sons of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

verses.text: And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons; and they served their gods.
parts: And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons; and they served their gods.

verses.text: In this way the sons of Israel did evil in the sight of the Lord.
parts: In this way the sons of Israel did evil in the sight of the Lord.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel, and He sold them into the hand of Cushan-Rishathaim king of Syria of the rivers; and the sons of Israel served Cushan-Rishathaim for eight years.
parts: Therefore the Lord was enraged with anger at Israel, and He sold them into the hand of Cushan-Rishathaim king of Syria of the rivers; and the sons of Israel served Cushan-Rishathaim for eight years.

verses.text: When the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a savior for Israel and saved them, that is, Othniel the son of Kenaz, the younger brother of Caleb.
parts: When the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a savior for Israel and saved them, that is, Othniel the son of Kenaz, the younger brother of Caleb.

verses.text: And the Spirit of the Lord came upon him, and he judged Israel.
parts: And the Spirit of the Lord came upon him, and he judged Israel.

verses.text: Then the land remained at peace for forty years.
parts: Then the land remained at peace for forty years.

verses.text: And the sons of Israel again did evil before the Lord.
parts: And the sons of Israel again did evil before the Lord.

verses.text: Then he gathered to himself all the sons of Ammon and Amalek, and went and struck Israel, and took possession of the City of Palms.
parts: Then he gathered to himself all the sons of Ammon and Amalek, and went and struck Israel, and took possession of the City of Palms.

verses.text: So the sons of Israel served Eglon king of Moab for eighteen years.
parts: So the sons of Israel served Eglon king of Moab for eighteen years.

verses.text: But when the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a savior for them, that is, Ehud the son of Gera, the son of Benjamin, a man equally adept with both of his hands.
parts: But when the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a savior for them, that is, Ehud the son of Gera, the son of Benjamin, a man equally adept with both of his hands.

verses.text: Now Ehud made himself a double-edged dagger, a cubit in length, and fastened it under his clothes on his right thigh.
parts: Now Ehud made himself a double-edged dagger, a cubit in length, and fastened it under his clothes on his right thigh.

verses.text: So he went forth and brought the gifts to Eglon king of Moab.
parts: So he went forth and brought the gifts to Eglon king of Moab.

verses.text: When Ehud had finished presenting the gifts, he sent away the people who had carried the gifts.
parts: When Ehud had finished presenting the gifts, he sent away the people who had carried the gifts.

verses.text: But he himself turned back from the carved images near Gilgal, and Ehud said, “I have a secret message for you, O king.” And Eglon said to him, “Keep silence!” And he sent away all his attendants.
parts: But he himself turned back from the carved images near Gilgal, and Ehud said, “I have a secret message for you, O king.” And Eglon said to him, “Keep silence!” And he sent away all his attendants.

verses.text: And Ehud went with him to the upper summer chamber, where he could sit by himself.
parts: And Ehud went with him to the upper summer chamber, where he could sit by himself.

verses.text: At the moment he arose, Ehud reached with his left hand, took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly,
parts: At the moment he arose, Ehud reached with his left hand, took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly,

verses.text: driving it in so the handle went in after the blade, until the fat closed over the blade.
parts: driving it in so the handle went in after the blade, until the fat closed over the blade.

verses.text: And Ehud left the porch and passed by the guards stationed there, having shut the doors of the upper room behind him and locked them.
parts: And Ehud left the porch and passed by the guards stationed there, having shut the doors of the upper room behind him and locked them.

verses.text: After he was gone, the king's servants went in and noticed the doors of the upper room were locked.
parts: After he was gone, the king's servants went in and noticed the doors of the upper room were locked.

verses.text: So they waited till they were embarrassed, and he had still not opened the doors of the upper room.
parts: So they waited till they were embarrassed, and he had still not opened the doors of the upper room.

verses.text: But Ehud had escaped while they were in confusion, and thus no one paid any attention to him.
parts: But Ehud had escaped while they were in confusion, and thus no one paid any attention to him.

verses.text: And when Ehud came into the land of Israel, he blew the trumpet in the mountains of Ephraim, and the sons of Israel went down with him from the mountains; and he stood before them.
parts: And when Ehud came into the land of Israel, he blew the trumpet in the mountains of Ephraim, and the sons of Israel went down with him from the mountains; and he stood before them.

verses.text: And he said to them, “Come down after me, for the Lord God has delivered our enemies the Moabites into our hand.” So they followed him and seized the fords of the Jordan leading to Moab, and did not allow anyone to cross over.
parts: And he said to them, “Come down after me, for the Lord God has delivered our enemies the Moabites into our hand.” So they followed him and seized the fords of the Jordan leading to Moab, and did not allow anyone to cross over.

verses.text: At that time they struck about ten thousand men of Moab, all men of strength; not a man escaped.
parts: At that time they struck about ten thousand men of Moab, all men of strength; not a man escaped.

verses.text: So Moab was put to shame that day under the hand of Israel.
parts: So Moab was put to shame that day under the hand of Israel.

verses.text: After him, Shamgar the son of Dinach rose up, and he struck six hundred men of the Philistines with the ploughshare of the oxen.
parts: After him, Shamgar the son of Dinach rose up, and he struck six hundred men of the Philistines with the ploughshare of the oxen.

verses.text: The sons of Israel continued to do evil before the Lord, and Ehud was dead, so the Lord sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor.
parts: The sons of Israel continued to do evil before the Lord, and Ehud was dead,
so the Lord sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor.

verses.text: And the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord; for Jabin had nine hundred iron chariots with him, and for twenty years he oppressed Israel with his power.
parts: And the sons of Israel cried out to the Lord; for Jabin had nine hundred iron chariots with him, and for twenty years he oppressed Israel with his power.

verses.text: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lapidoth, was judge of Israel at that time. And Deborah would sit under the palm tree between Ramah and Bethel on Mount Ephraim.
parts: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lapidoth, was judge of Israel at that time.
And Deborah would sit under the palm tree between Ramah and Bethel on Mount Ephraim.

verses.text: And Deborah would sit under the palm tree between Ramah and Bethel on Mount Ephraim.
parts: And Deborah would sit under the palm tree between Ramah and Bethel on Mount Ephraim.

verses.text: Then Deborah sent and called for Barak the son of Abinoam from Kedesh Naphtali, and said to him, “Has not the Lord God of Israel commanded, ‘Go to Mount Tabor and take with you ten thousand men of the sons of Naphtali and of the sons of Zebulun.
parts: Then Deborah sent and called for Barak the son of Abinoam from Kedesh Naphtali, and said to him, “Has not the Lord God of Israel commanded, ‘Go to Mount Tabor and take with you ten thousand men of the sons of Naphtali and of the sons of Zebulun.

verses.text: and I will bring to you, at the brook of Kishon, the captain of the army of Jabin, with his chariots and his multitude, and I will deliver them into your hands’?”
parts: and I will bring to you, at the brook of Kishon, the captain of the army of Jabin, with his chariots and his multitude, and I will deliver them into your hands’?”

verses.text: And Barak said to her, “If you go with me, then I will go; but if you do not go with me, I will remain here, for I am unable to discern the day when the Angel of the Lord will help me.”
parts: And Barak said to her, “If you go with me, then I will go; but if you do not go with me, I will remain here, for I am unable to discern the day when the Angel of the Lord will help me.”

verses.text: She said, “Certainly I will go with you; but know this: there will be no honor gained by you on the journey you are undertaking, for the Lord will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman.”
parts: She said, “Certainly I will go with you; but know this: there will be no honor gained by you on the journey you are undertaking, for the Lord will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman.”

verses.text: Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali from Kedesh, and went from there with ten thousand men following him.
parts: Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali from Kedesh, and went from there with ten thousand men following him.

verses.text: Now Heber the Kenite, of the sons of Hobab, the father-in-law of Moses, moved away from the Kenites and pitched his tent upon arriving at the oak tree of coveting, which is near Kedesh.
parts: Now Heber the Kenite, of the sons of Hobab, the father-in-law of Moses, moved away from the Kenites and pitched his tent upon arriving at the oak tree of coveting, which is near Kedesh.

verses.text: And they reported to Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor.

verses.text: And Jael went out to meet Sisera and said to him, “Turn aside, my lord, turn aside to me; do not fear.” And when he had turned aside with her, entering into the tent, she covered him with a blanket.

verses.text: Then Sisera said to her, “Please give me a little water to drink, for I am thirsty.” So she opened a jug of milk, gave him a drink, and covered him.

verses.text: Now the weight of the gold earrings which he requested was one thousand five hundred pieces of gold, besides the crescent ornaments, pendants, garments, and purple robes worn by the kings of Midian, and the chains around the necks of their camels.

verses.text: Abimelech son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem, to his mother's brothers, and he spoke to them and to everyone in the family of his mother's father, saying, “I pray you to ask in the hearing of all the men of Shechem, ‘Which is better for you, for all seventy of the sons of Jerubbaal to reign over you, or for one to reign over you?’ Remember, I am of your own bone and flesh.” And his mother's brothers spoke all these words concerning him in the hearing of all the men of Shechem; and their heart was inclined to follow Abimelech, for they said, “He is our brother.” They gave him seventy shekels of silver from the house of Baal-Berith, and Abimelech hired for himself vain and cowardly men; and they followed him.

verses.text: But the olive tree said to them, ‘Should I cease giving my richness, with which men will glorify God, and go to be placed over the trees?’

parts: But the vine said to them, ‘Should I cease my wine, which cheers both God and men, and go to be placed over the trees?’

verses.text: And the bramble said to the trees, ‘If in truth you anoint me as king over you, then come and take shelter in my shade; but if not, may fire come from me and devour the cedars of Lebanon!’
parts: And the bramble said to the trees, ‘If in truth you anoint me as king over you, then come and take shelter in my shade; but if not, may fire come from me and devour the cedars of Lebanon!’

verses.text: “And now, if you have acted in truth and integrity, and have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and with his house, and if you have done to him according to the reward of his hand, as my father fought in war for you, and put his life in jeopardy, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian; but you have risen up against my father's house today, and killed his seventy sons upon one stone, and made Abimelech, the son of his bondwoman, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother.

verses.text: And early in the morning, at the same time the sun rises, move your battle line toward the city; and behold, he and the people with him will come out against you, and you shall do to him as much as is in your power.”

verses.text: After Abimelech, Tola the son of Puah arose to save Israel, the son of his father's brother, a man of Issachar; and he dwelt in Shamir on Mount Ephraim. He judged Israel twenty-three years; and he died and was buried in Shamir.
parts: After Abimelech, Tola the son of Puah arose to save Israel, the son of his father's brother, a man of Issachar; and he dwelt in Shamir on Mount Ephraim.
He judged Israel twenty-three years; and he died and was buried in Shamir.

verses.text: After him arose Jair of Gilead; and he judged Israel twenty-two years.
parts: After him arose Jair of Gilead; and he judged Israel twenty-two years.

verses.text: He had thirty-two sons who rode on thirty-two colts, and they had thirty-two cities, which are called the villages of Jair to this day in the land of Gilead.

verses.text: And Jair died and was buried in Ramnon.

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel again did evil in the sight of the Lord, serving Baals and the Ashtoreths, the gods of Arad, the gods of Sidon, the gods of Moab, the gods of the sons of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines; and they forsook the Lord and did not serve Him.

verses.text: And the Lord was enraged with anger against Israel, and He delivered them into the hands of the Philistines and into the hands of the sons of Ammon.

verses.text: And they afflicted and oppressed the sons of Israel for a time of eighteen years, all the children of Israel beyond the Jordan in the land of the Amorites, in Gilead.

verses.text: So the Lord said to the sons of Israel, “Did I not deliver you from the Egyptians and from the Amorites and from the sons of Ammon and from the Philistines, from the Sidonians and Amalekites and Maonites who oppressed you when you cried out to Me, and I delivered you from their hand?

verses.text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was being exalted in power, but he was the son of a harlot who bore Jephthah to Gilead. Gilead's wife bore sons, and when his wife's sons grew up, they drove Jephthah out and said to him, “You shall have no inheritance in our father's house, for you are the son of another woman.” Then Jephthah fled before his brothers and dwelt in the land of Tob; and vain men banded together with Jephthah, and they went out with him.

verses.text: And it came to be that the sons of Ammon made war against Israel, and the elders of Gilead went to get Jephthah from the land of Tob.

author: Traditionally believed to be Samuel. The book was written in Palestine during his early ministry.
date: Judges (meaning “rulers”) was written three centuries after the entry of the tribes of Israel into Canaan under Joshua, and covers the events of those centuries.
theme: God's continual deliverance of a people that had forgotten Him and the Law. The book begins with compromise and ends in anarchy. It is a record of Israel's forsaking God and of His forsaking Israel because of their disobedience.
